headline: Ohio collecting surplus helmets, vests for Ukraine defense
author: Associated Press
sentences: The governor said that more than two dozen law enforcement agencies have offered approximately 75 ballistic and riot helmets and 840 pieces of body armor, including vests and plates.
Mike DeWine has announced that the state is collecting hundreds of helmets, protective vests and other surplus police equipment for the civilian defense of Ukraine.

The Fund to Aid Ukraine is a nonprofit organization based in Parma in suburban Cleveland, which has a large Ukrainian-American population.

DeWine said Friday the fund will coordinate the delivery of Ohio's equipment donations to Ukraine.
